author: Sarky
title: Nice introduction to Technic
review:
Box

Very simple but nice box. On the back, the "pull-back" feature is present along with the alternate model that can be made by combining the parts form this set and set #42034

Parts

As someone new to Technic, I am not fully aware of the values of particular pieces. Parts that stood out to me were the airplane-like steering wheel and the tail. Most of the parts in this set are either white, black or dark blue.

Minifigures

Oops! No minifigs here :)

The build

The build was set in a nice, simple pace. It was very enjoyable and gives you an insight into the inner workings of bigger Technic sets. I was surprised as the whole process took longer than expected, a complete half an hour!

The completed model

Unlike many other sets from the Technic line, this set has very few 'holes' and hollow spaces through it. The front is quite sleek and and handle a bashing of sorts. There is motor detail above the bonnet, probably of some engine intake. The cockpit can open to reveal a nicely shaped seat along with a completely horizontal steering wheel. Finally, there is a tail at the back. Underneath, there is a black wheel which represents a thruster.

The main function of the set is the pull-back motor which works well. It can be pulled quite a ways back. And when released, it zooms past with astonishing speed and distance.

Overall opinion

This set is very inviting to people who have no past experience with Technic. It provides a simple, yet good Technic model that works fine. There are only 6 stickers and this set is suitable for many ages of people who want to explore the world of Technic without emptying their wallet at first! :)

P.S. As for the ratings, a 3/5 is a average in my ratings.

author: Sarang
title: Vroom!!!
review:
The pull back racers are a great introduction to LEGO Technic in general. The low piece count and price means that it is a value for money purchase for young kids. Now moving on,

PARTS

Even though this site is relatively small it has a handful of interesting parts to offer. The dark blue curved technic panel pieces which are quite rare and not found in any other sets. Other notable parts include a few panels in white ; the steering wheel, tail fin and the low profile tires.

BUILD

It is breezy and easy to follow for young children since the instructions have a good pace. Nonetheless it hardly takes any time to build the set, just about half an hour.

COMPLETED MODEL

The completed model is surprisingly long and sleek. It does not have any camera unfriendly side and looks good from all angles.

It has some nice touches like the engine intake on the front and the exhaust at the back. There is just enough space to fit a minifig (yay!).

The pullback motor coupled with the low profile tires gives the car it's namesake Record Breaker speed! and what speed! it whooshes like an arrow!!

LAST THOUGHTS

Overall this is a fun model to build, play with and simply enjoy ! In the end this is a neat set that everyone will love, the target group and the parts collectors alike.
